p: The device was placed in the chamber of a stage top WSKM GM2000 incubation system (Tokai, Japan) adapted to a Nikon Eclipse Ti inverted microscope (Nikon, Japan) equipped with a ProScan II motorized flat top stage (Prior Scientific, USA). With this setup, bright-field and fluorescence images of the microwells were automatically acquired every 30 min from 2.5 to 24 hours postinfection. In each image, 36 (6 × 6) microwells were included with a CFI60 Plan Apochromat Lambda 10× objective and a Hamamatsu C11440 camera.
